column5: I'm a member of a group of fishing enthusiasts who have been fishing together for over 50 years. Although we get together during the year for special occasions, we always get together a week before Christmas at the local pizza and beer pub (for us that's the Prescott). This year we had 15 guys in attendance. And as usual, we all updated each other on our ailments (we're all seniors between 72 and 81 years of age). Two of our guys underwent open heart surgery during 2015. Fortunately, we are all still walking on the right side of the grass. And some of us still very much enjoy wetting our lines for walleye in August and September each year.  I'm grateful to be alive and to be a member of this group.  Seasons Greetings everyone.
I bet the tales, fishing or not are something to behold.  Nice to hear, merry christmas to you and your buds.
Great post, Tomcat. I can feel the emotion in that one. Thanks for sharing. You and yours have a Merry Christmas and a healthy, happy New Year.
You're a good guy Jay!  And best to you and all your buds for the holidays, 2016 and many years beyond that.
Good on ya I am 31 and it's hard to see some of my best buds once a year.
Wow!  That's great that you guys still get together, considering the age group.  Good on ya!
Thats great that you've been friends with that group for so many years and still going strong Tomcats.  Love reading those kind of stories !!
